conclusion: To find the electric field strength at the intersection of the diagonals of the square, consider contributions from each charge.
The square has side length L, with charges +q at A and B, and -q at C and D.
The distance from each charge to the center O is L/√2.
The electric field due to a point charge q at a distance r is E = kq/r².
For each charge, the distance to O is L/√2.
Calculate electric field magnitude from charges +q at A and B: EA = EB = 2kq/L².
Calculate electric field magnitude from charges -q at C and D: EC = ED = -2kq/L².
Electric field due to +q at A points away from A towards O.
Electric field due to +q at B points away from B towards O.
Electric field due to -q at C points towards C from O.
Electric field due to -q at D points towards D from O.
Electric fields from A and B are in the same direction (towards O).
Electric fields from C and D are in the opposite direction (away from O).
Fields from A and B cancel fields from C and D.
Resultant electric field at O is zero.
The electric field strength at the intersection of the diagonals of the square is 0.
